title: Modeling-Based Interdisciplinary Learning: Integrated Understanding Through Hydraulic Arm Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic geometry (angle, distance measurement) and understanding of simple scientific principles
context.additional_context: Hybrid learning environment using VR equipment and LMS, incorporating a low-cost prototype (virtual hydraulic arm) to ensure participation for all learners, including those with learning disabilities.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the operating mechanism of hydraulic arms in three or more representational forms (diagrams, formulas, simulations) through modeling
Learners can accurately calculate joint angles of hydraulic arms within a 5° error margin using angle-measurement tools
In VR simulations, learners can predict object movement distances by applying the concept of linear change and compare/analyze experimental results
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
